metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9229 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Oniguruma 6.2.0, as used in Oniguruma-mod inRuby through 2.4.1 and mbstring in PHP through 7.1.5. A SIGSEGV occurs inleft_adjust_char_head() during regular expression compilation. Invalidhandling of reg->dmax in forward_search_range() could result in an invalidpointer dereference, normally as an immediate denial-of-service condition.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9229` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libonig2 - 5.9.1-1ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

libapache2-mod-php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.22
libapache2-mod-php5filter - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.22
libphp5-embed - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.22
php-pear - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.22
php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.22

No subscription required

criterions.comment: libonig package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.9.1-1ubuntu1.1').
php5 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.22').
